TopicTitle: Kind of a quick question for people who know about codes [not a suport question]

Articles.Content: Is it possible for someone who knows about coding in the game to make the Kerbals in the bottom right corner have Apollo/Skylab A7L suits on like they did when they launched the Saturn V?
The Kerbals are not currently mod-abble. They\'ve been built into the game using unity, so you don\'t have access to their models or textures.

> 
> The Kerbals are not currently mod-abble. They\'ve been built into the game using unity, so you don\'t have access to their models or textures.

Thanks. You can lock if you\'d like.
I\'ve always wanted to mod those guys. For example, after reading Closette\'s Goddard Challenge thread, I wanted to add a yellow sticky to Jeb\'s helmet visor.

Programmers literally have the power to do anything and anyone once they become good enough at it.

After you compile c++ though, you can\'t decompile it.

Its not really a coding issue, its changing the model and texture of the actual kerbals, which would be super simple.

However, the current models are locked into the game assets and are not mod-able as C7 said, and decompiling any of the game assets is against the Terms of Service.

Someday, maybe ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Locking this on the OPs request.
